intro: Backeria annulata, commonly known as the ringed backeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Backeria annulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
